name: Turbo Dismount™
description: Turbo Dismount is a kinetic tragedy about Mr. Dismount and the cars who love him. It is the official sequel to the wildly popular and immensely successful personal impact simulator - Stair Dismount.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: Intel Core 2 or better Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX9 compatible graphics card DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 300 MB available space Sound Card: Any

reviews.review_text: I found this game insanly funny and entertaing. I highly recomend it to the destructive type

What does Turbo Dismount have to offer as a game? Spills, thrills, and mega destruction! This is one of those games that you can pick up very easily and its simple, mindless fun. There is no goal to Turbo Dismount, you kinda just set up a level and watch the carnage. With many customizable options, you can choose how Mr.Dismount explodes or gets beheaded... IN STYLE! If you have a very specific kind of humor and wouldn't find a lifeless body being torn apart and vehicles being ripped apart entertaining (there is no blood in this game as a side note), then this game isn't for you. If you are thinking about buying it and it looks like your cup of tea, go for it! If your looking for a story or an adventure, look elsewhere, because this is the epitome of stupid fun!

A very fun dismount game. All you need to do is to kill Mr Dismount and others then getting high scores like around 10 to 30,000,000 and more. The workshop levels are great also, with famous players like Markiplier, Jacksepticeye playing with those. Some workshop levels are very funny when like a mystery boost pad where you explode into pieces. Even some levels can help get you achievements also. Its my first ever crash game on Steam. If you love crashin', you better buy this game!

Turbo Dismount is a game where the little guy falls out of the car and then the car runs him over. Turbo Dismount is where the little guy pedals his tricycle off of a cliff and down five stories onto landmines which launch him up into the air. Turbo Dismount is where the little guy does a loop-de-loop on a section of road and drives straight into a patch of landmines at top speed, making him and his car explode rather spectacularly. Turbo Dismount is where a guy gets into a drag race and finishes it by plowing his car into a wall.  I could tell you about a hundred of these stories, but it's basically a guy, a car, and a set of circumstances in which you have to figure out how to inflict maximum pain on the guy, and the punchline involves grevious bodily harm.  It's a joke you can re-experience and re-tool over and over, but the punchline itself starts to get stale around four hours after you've played out all the variations of 'What happens when an (adjective) (character) in a (type of car) drives into a (insert hazard here)?'. It's a bit like Mad Libs, but with physics and objects.  I don't see myself playing this again anytime soon, but the time I did spend with it was hilarious, and there's a level based off of the Springfield Gorge scene from an early Simpsons episode called 'Bart The Daredevil'. So there's your recommendation.

After almost 225 hours in this game and downloading over 100 workshop levels including all of the default maps, i have to say this is the most fun game that I played on my gaming PC, but still play great on my old one. It stood the test of time, is still a lot of fun, and has been nominated, personnally, by me, for the Best Game For Slow Computers Award.
What fun !  Killing the crash test dummy over and over
Very youtubey game (5NaF, anyone?) but its pretty fun if you like causing carnage.
This game really helped me out in my insurance fraud scheme! Thanks Secret Exit Ltd.!

This game right here is a ultimate chill game. The music is relaxing and good and the game itself is just to have fun. I have to admit that I've had a ton of fun with this. Plus this game is highly customizable and the the dismounts have almost infinite outcomes considering how many different maps, vehicles, characters and objects there are. There's also steam workshop to get more!

This game is so good i am going to die,it is so amazing.Buy this now!

This is more of a party game to be honest. If you have some friends round, or you're maybe making a YouTube video, this is great fun, however as you'll see by my hours, it can get boring on your own - quite quickly. This is probably down to the fact that there is no in-game level editor, you instead have to install Unity - which is a breeze for some (1% of the world' population) and an absoloute pain in the backside for others. The mechanics are nice however and watching your 'Dismounts' in slow-mo just feels amazingly satisfying. All in all, I give Turbo Dismount around 6/10.
great game with amazing things in it keep the updates coming *also have stair dismount*

A girl riding her motorcycle for the first time,- towards a minefield just before crossing the highway- swarming with cars. Both arms broken + one leg, head dismembered and a foot that's missing. Welcome to Turbo Dismount. Make your own level, play a default one or browse the workshop for some crazy uploads.  The game features replays in slow motion (if desired), a bunch of different vehicles to use, buckload of levels and though not many, the achievements are pretty easy as well as funny to achieve. I like to think of the game as a simulator for traffic/crashing. At least that goes for the ragdoll-effect and how bad you get injured. :scythe:
I haven't seen such a great sequel since Left 4 Dead 2
After playing the Mobile Stair fall. and i found this game. i just had to get it. i love the physics and stuff. i love these kind of games.
Fantastic fun this is. Regular updates never make this boring :)

Aaand, there he goes into the ongoing traffic! *SPLAT*   Turbo Dismount is a game that can evidently only be described as a kinetic tragedy. Yes, I'm aware that it says that right on the image, but isn't it true nonetheless?  The basic premise of this game involves you controlling a car 'driven' by a ragdoll known as Mr. Dismount (or any of the other characters). Choose the vehicle, the character, the pose, what obstacles there should be on the road and where to go and you have a recipe for fun and laughter all around!  Anyone looking for physics-based entertainment has to get this game, I kid you not.
This Game Is Totally Awsome 10/10 The Graphics Is Awsome

Here's what I do:   Go Online.   Find a picture of a developer's face from the game I am raging on.   Launch Turbo Dismount™   Plaster that face on the character.   Find the most destructive level.   Send that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ into total destruction.   Feel better.   Go back to the previous game.   Repeat.  It also amuses my younger brother and keeps him occupied when I'm supposed to be watching him. In other words... Netflix time. 10/10

This is all I have to say:  This game is worth $10 more that it's price. It is so much fun to watch your test dummy fly through a windshield into a highway full of plows and bulldosers. I fully recommend this game, it's a fun and humorous game utilizing pretty good ragdoll physics, with the smart twist of being able to build levels or play User-Built levels. With so many possibilities at building you will very possibly get extremely funny dismounts or just land hilarious poses and even do sweet and neat stunts! The vehicle logo feature and the face feature just add up, with the vehicle logo feature you can make vehicles look cooler, or maybe use it in advantage of a machinima, and use the face feature to make dismounts/replays funnier, or you can put in the most cartoon character you hate's face and satisfy yourself!  10/10  Brought me and will probably bring me more hilarious moments that make me laugh for minutes and minutes.

Turbo Dismount is a gem of a game.  The premise is simple: you control a crash dummy and your goal is to toss it against vehicles, obstacles and objects to get a high score. There is a fair ammount of customization in the game. The dummy can be strapped to a variety of vehicles (including rides from an office chair to a monster truck). Each of these vehicles allows you to select from different poses in which the dummy can be positioned. You can even upload a photo of a friend/enemy and paste it onto the dummy's head!   There are also different stages, which range from simple straightways to huge intersections of heavy traffic meant to maximize carnage. These stages can also be customized with different obstacles like turbo pads, roadblocks or minefieds. The game also has steam workshop support, allowing you to download additional stages.  After you finish customizing your dummy and stage, you choose a speed and direction and let the physics engine do its thing. The dummy and vehicle can be broken down in multiple itty bitty parts, each increasing your score based on how hard they hit objects in the stage. After things settle down the replay feature kicks in and you can see the carnage in slow motion. As far as I know there's no option to save replays in game. But you'll be creating so many spectacular crashes that it's not a big deal.  While the premise of Turbo Dismount is basic, it has it down right. It calls to the simple pleasures of childhood, in which throwing your toy cars against makeshift buildings or laughing at people falling in America's Funniest Home Videos was all the entertaiment you needed. You always knew what was coming, but you couldn't help but laugh or wince everytime it happened. You may not put hundreds of hours into this game. Yet you'll be glad that when you want you can throw your toy car against traffic and watch the parts fly.

Great game and very fun to play. When you can watch a nondescript ragdoll get torn apart in a violent crash, in super slow motion or thrown from the roof of a monster truck speeding down the highway, it doesn't get much better than that. 10/10

This game is utterly euphoric. I felt enlightened by smashing a tricycle into oncoming traffic while my rag doll (who had the face of my real life competition) fly into space, only to fall back onto the highway where he was hit multiple times by a bus, a sedan, and then some weird snow plow thing. I then proceeded to try to imitate this as I am an impressionable gamer who the media likes to blame. I do not recommend reenacting this game in real life, as it angers and bothers people, but do Indeed highly recommend this wonderfully delightful game.
Turbo Dismount Ahh what a fine specimen

Sorry. Orginal truck dismount (rekkaturva) was fun gme when it was released on Assembly fair in Finland 2003. This Turbo dismount is commercial version of this game with lot impovements. But i played this game couple of hours for my youtube video. But didnt played it for just fun.

I picked this game up not to long ago and god damn it was worth it. Hours upon hours of fun alone and with friends heartlessly killing poor Mr.Dismount hundreds of times over. Great stress reliever, it's cheap (£7 thats it!), endless fun and community created levels! What else could you want!  11/10 - Would torture again.  -Fusion

I have been playing this series since Stair Dismount (♥♥♥♥♥sturvat), and this is the sort of thing I've always hoped it would evolve into. Plenty of vehicles, good obstacle options, a satisfying proportion of maps (they aren't all good), and excellent poses. This is the only series of games that causes me to burst into laughter and at some point I hope to soil my pants in the process.

I always wait until I'm streaming to play this game, so I'm still learning the ropes of what this game has to offer. So why am I recommending it? The first time I booted up this game, I realized how much potential it has, not just as a casual game, but from a content creation standpoint. This is the kind of game in which you share your experiences with others, and subsequently laugh your asses off at the same crash for minutes at a time. My only regret? Being so quick to buy the game that I didn't wait for it to go on sale. But honestly, it's worth every penny at its original price.

This is one of my favourite games to just sit back and relax(it relieves anxiety almost as well as Xanax). If you think you might enjoy a non linear funny physics sim where cars/trucks slam into each other and other objects then this is the game for you. and at its cirrent price its a no brainer.

This game is absolutely hilarious! But I am going to give this game the same type of review that I've seen people give Goat Simulator; It is a great concept for a game, and it is massively entertaining if you have friends over. But it just doesn't hold your attention. Now I know that the Devs update the game, but it just isn't enough content. If it was a Free to Play title I would definitely recommend everyone to try it, but sadly it is not. It is still a very fun and well-polished game and I hope that the rest of the Steam community doesn't take this review as an insult to the game.

I dont think i like this game anymore. It just got old. All you do is Smash into walls, Mines, and other cars. Honestly the game needs More content, Mod Workshop, and The ability to make your own car.

Got this at 50% off (£3) and it's not worth that. Really very silly, ugly, primitive waste of money. Would have passed two minutes and been deleted if it was free. Passed two minutes and got deleted at half price as well.   Save your money!

Less funny than it looks like. Basically you get a bunch of tracks, vehicles, characters and obstacles to cause accidents. You have less control than it seems, you can place objects only where the game allows you to.  Basically you have to push a button and let the vehicle crash into random stuff, far from being interactive. The physics it's far from perfects, every vehicles (especially the NPC ones) are mostly made of rubber and don't even get wrecked. The ragdoll effect is acceptable, but I've seen better. I don't see the point of having different characters and motorbikes if they can't ride them for more than a few seconds and barely reach the obstacles you have placed. Every other vehicle is mostly useless, ranging from huge, slow and totally unfunny to see crashing to intolerbly fast cars, seeing them crashing after a second from start. Also most of the time your character will fall out of the vehicle before crashing anywhere, thus ending the session very early. Other than that, you have to follow some predetermined steering paths which the vehicles can't even follow correctly. You have manual steering but it doesn't make the game any funnier. The default cameras are placed very badly, not letting you see anything. You have to use the manual one which is barely good depending on how you can handle it.  It could have been a good idea, but it's very badly developed. I would rather wait for a fully functional BeamNG.
0/10 no one plays multiplayer
Camera just kept spinning. Couldn't figure it out in about 10 minutes. Oh well, save your 3.50.

This game was Awesome! but... only for the first hour. i had almost no problems with it, the crashes are always spectacular, though there was no in game recorder to record the spectacular displays with, so if you do an amazing crash (lets say you crashed into a pole and then got runover by a truck, then a car, then the pole colapsed and your head flew off) you cant easily record this (i had to spend 20 mins trying to find a good game recorder). Now for the workshop content - great! player made tracks! But no workshop content for any extra cars, or vehicles. so sad  this game could have been great! but unfortunately these two things it was not :( - i would recomend this to anybody who already has a game recorder, or for anybody younger than 10  - i would recomend beamng.drive over this - more expensive and more demanding , but so - SO mutch more worth it  - will not be refunding this game due to my younger brother - of which is younger than 10 (he loves it, for now)   5 ---  10

IMO, this simulator was amusing during 20 minutes, then I lost any interest. You can drive, program a trajectory and you have a goal to reach in each level. The characters poses and animations are fun when they crash. That's about it. Even at 60% discount, I'm not sure it's worth buying. But if you really love that kind of stuff, you may want to take it while it's on sale.

A real fun game, but without any purpose other than destroy vehicles and the person driving them! If you are into, having fun seeing a rag doll crash dummy, being shread to pieces then that is a good game! For anyone else you are going to get bored real quick!

A slight change of mind on my last review, yes I will admit that this game was initially fun, but I have found it lost it's charm rather quickly, partly due to repetition & lack of content. This game feels slightly incomplete to me due to having such a heavy reliance on Steam Workshop integration for it's mininal amount of content.  I would only advise this if you are after a stress reliever to play in short bursts, otherwise, I would suggest looking elsewhere.
